description: Implementation of swap test is a quantum function that checks the overlap between two quantum states. The inputs of the function are two quantum registers of the same size, , and it returns as output a single test qubit whose state encodes the overlap between the two inputs: , with \alpha^2 = \frac{1}{2}\left(1+|\langle \psi_1 |\psi_2 \rangle |^2\right). Thus, the probability of measuring the test qubit at state is if the states are identical (up to a global phase) and 0.
